intro: Rubroshorea negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros redshorea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom during the dry season. It thrives in tropical rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
